data.title: Nice place
data.text: I took my 7 year old nephew and we had a blast! It's a place where you have to use your imagination! At first, he just ran around looking at things, but after a while, he really got in to pretending and figuring out the exhibits. We spent about 3 hours there. You will lose a kid, but don't worry, the place is small and there's only 1 way in and out & someone watching the door!

data.title: Field trip
data.text: I love it!! We took the kids cmoe they love. I wish more time there. But all everyone had. Good day. My kids had Great time.

data.title: A good outing for the whole family.
data.text: Great place for kids and the kid in you. Lots to do and the area has some nice restaurants in the revitalized downtown with The Ford Center for sports action and concerts a short walk away.

data.title: Love it
data.text: This is a hands on museum.  The kids are actually  encouraged to touch & play!! Tje adults can also join in the fun!.

data.title: A fun time
data.text: We had a great time, there could have been some more supervision at the chi it that blows the tulle scarves out of the tubes. There were some very rough children. But that's just kids being kids. The water room was a hit with my kids.

data.title: Great summer fun
data.text: Great place to go during hot summer days. Keep children busy and learning while having fun. Lots of hands on activities

data.title: Great museum for kids
data.text: This is an excellent museum for very young kids and for older kids. They offer a lot of different stations on separate levels. It is a fun place to visit

data.title: Nice for younger children
data.text: This is a great, hands-on type of museum that is geared towards the 3-8 year old crowd. Many different areas giving young sprouts lots of things to explore, see, and do. Designed so parents can keep an eye on children but yet let them move about and take It all in.

data.title: Interactive Fun
data.text: We really enjoyed CMOE.  We have a 6 year old and a 13 year old and we all had fun.  Beware the wet deck and bring flip flops and maybe even a change of clothes!

data.title: A great place to visit for the entire family
data.text: I went their with my family and it was just great, had a good time as well my girls. Children's  Museum is clean and nice any time of the year to visit I recommend it.

data.title: Four for the activities, five for the staff
data.text: I've been to about 20 kids museums over the last few years, and this one is fun, with one issue (safety related). This is not like the big league museums in Indianapolis, st Louis or San Francisco, yet better than small ones all over the country, so I would say a four star rating. Unique exhibits like the water room, ball cannon, and handkerchief tubes were great, but the layout makes it so easy to lose sight of the kids running around between the rooms and exhibits. That's exactly what happened to my 2 year old. He was having so much fun, and ran around one exhibit to the next. When I went following him, he was gone from sight. Talk about a parents worst nightmare thinking your child went missing. I notified staff right away, who were awesome by locking the place down, giving a description out to all staff by walkie talkie, and checking every room/floor. After about 5 excruciating minutes, he was found riding the elevator! So a five star for the staff, with one huge caveat; the place needs to be child proofed by making sure the buttons aren't reachable to little ones, securing each room/entrance separately (gate?) and maybe eliminating blind spots if feasible. I know it's ultimately my responsibility as a parent, but multiple open rooms and an easy access front door is a flawed layout. You can tell the museum was put into an older building that wasn't designed for curious kids. Please make this a five all around!

data.title: Fun for the kids
data.text: My family and I have been here a couple of times. It's fun for the kids. There are some neat activities, but they need to change things up a little. I give it a three because of the other children's museums in the area (STL, INDY). It's still fun for the kids if your in Evansville.

data.title: Decent for a visit or two
data.text:
Honestly, if your kids have never been, it's worth visiting. Before our first time, I had high expectations and was somewhat disappointed with the amount of exhibits.  There is such a big building that they have the space for many more displays--and with the admission prices, it seems they should have the resources for more. What they do have is good, there just aren't enough things to do to keep us coming back.  
 I know Evansville can't compete with St. Louis or Indianapolis, but I wish the staff or the board or whoever is in charge would visit a first rate children's museum and get some ideas. 
If you like CMOE, take your kids to the Magic House in St. Louis--you'll be blown away.

data.title: Expected Less, Got More
data.text: CMOE was a nice children's museum.  Based on TA reviews, I expected it to be average or only slightly above.  My twin daughters (ages 2) and son (age 8) found lots to keep them occupied for at least three hours.  The staff was very helpful and polite.  It's worth a visit.

data.title: 11-21-2015  afternoon
data.text: Was a little disappointing , a Huge T Rex outside, expected some Dinosaur displays . Children still had a good time, and a lot of fun..........

data.title: Small but mighty and constantly growing
data.text: It's not large, by other children's museums, but it has something other museums don't have: A Quake Factory! That's where children can explore the wet world of dams, weather, whirlpools and get good and soaked - so save it for the end of your tour! There is an area just for toddlers, that includes building a house of foam bricks and unearthing dinosaur bones. Children can pretend dress and play the stringless harp. They LOVE climbing through the nose and trying to beat the brain game. (Heck, I even enjoyed that - but lost....) There's an interactive stage with costumes, a place to paint your face, the world of drums to hear all the different sounds they make, the world of rain to explore and another toddler area where the little ones can go to relax with their adults when things get to be too much. The Koch museum is housed in the former Evansville Library.

data.title: Great place to take the grandchildren
data.text: Our grandchild took some arts/craft classes there.  The staff was great.  The kids had a ball while learning.. There are lots of "hand-on" things to do.

data.title: Lots of Fun to Enjoy!
data.text: Had an outing with my friends six grandchildren and boy did we have fun!!! This place is full of exciting and interesting things to do! Whomever planned this gets kudos from me. Really enjoyed the kids acting out the play and being able to watch the video afterward to see themselves in action. Loved the gears that were magnets to the wall to make your own formation to make them work together to spin! Really enjoyed the water room and shooting balls from the upper deck. We just had a wonderful time with each experience!!  Kids were age 2 to 10, my daughter 23 and my friends and I are 53--fun for ALL ages!!!!

data.title: Fun, Fun Place to Take Kids
data.text: My wife and I took our three grandchildren to the Children's Museum of Evansville, twice last week.  I cannot say that the nine month old enjoyed much more than watching the activities of her brothers and the other kids, but the four and two year olds had a blast.  There are many, many engaging activities that are also very educational.  I am an educator, and I was most impressed by the fact that the activities held the interest of my young grandchildren far longer than I might have expected.  Definitely worth the time!!

data.title: OK for the afternoon
data.text: I've  been to this museum a couple of times.  The first time was nice.  My child really enjoyed the ball room.  However I've been back twice to find it's all the same installations.
